info.title: Deadlock API
info.description:
## API Clients

We have auto generated and updated clients for many languages. You can find them here: [https://github.com/deadlock-api/openapi-clients](https://github.com/deadlock-api/openapi-clients)

## Support the Deadlock API

Whether you're building your own database, developing data science projects, or enhancing your website with game and player analytics, the Deadlock API has the data you need.

Your sponsorship helps keep this resource open, free and future-proof for everyone. By supporting the Deadlock API, you will enable continued development, new features and reliable access for developers, analysts and streamers worldwide.

Help us continue to provide the data you need - sponsor the Deadlock API today!

**-> You can Sponsor the Deadlock API on [Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/c/user?u=68961896) or [GitHub](https://github.com/sponsors/raimannma)**

## Disclaimer
_deadlock-api.com is not endorsed by Valve and does not reflect the views or opinions of Valve or anyone officially involved in producing or managing Valve properties. Valve and all associated properties are trademarks or registered trademarks of Valve Corporation_

get.description:
Retrieves statistics for the ability order of a hero.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: hero_id
parameters.description: See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/heroes>

parameters.name: game_mode
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their game mode. Valid values: `normal`, `street_brawl`. **Default:** `normal`.

parameters.name: min_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp). **Default:** 30 days ago.

parameters.name: max_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp).

parameters.name: min_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: max_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: min_ability_upgrades
parameters.description: Filter players based on their minimum number of ability upgrades over the whole match.

parameters.name: max_ability_upgrades
parameters.description: Filter players based on their maximum number of ability upgrades over the whole match.

parameters.name: min_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: max_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: min_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: max_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: min_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: max_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: min_matches
parameters.description: The minimum number of matches played for an ability order to be included in the response.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Filter for matches with a specific player account ID.

parameters.name: account_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of account ids to include

500.description: Failed to fetch ability order stats

get.description:
This endpoint returns the player badge distribution.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: game_mode
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their game mode. Valid values: `normal`, `street_brawl`. **Default:** `normal`.

parameters.name: min_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp). **Default:** 30 days ago.

parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: max_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: min_match_id

parameters.name: max_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

get.description:
Retrieves item statistics from hero builds.

Results are cached for **1 hour** based on the unique combination of query parameters provided. Subsequent identical requests within this timeframe will receive the cached response.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: hero_id
parameters.description: Filter builds based on the hero ID. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/heroes>

parameters.name: min_last_updated_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter builds based on their last updated time (Unix timestamp). **Default:** 30 days ago.

parameters.name: max_last_updated_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter builds based on their last updated time (Unix timestamp).

500.description: Failed to fetch build item stats

get.description:
Retrieves overall statistics for each hero combination.

Results are cached for **1 hour**. The cache key is determined by the specific combination of filter parameters used in the query. Subsequent requests using the exact same filters within this timeframe will receive the cached response.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: game_mode
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their game mode. Valid values: `normal`, `street_brawl`. **Default:** `normal`.

parameters.name: min_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp). **Default:** 30 days ago.

parameters.name: max_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp).

parameters.name: min_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: max_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: min_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: max_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: min_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: max_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: min_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: max_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: include_hero_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of hero ids to include. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/heroes>

parameters.name: exclude_hero_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of hero ids to exclude. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/heroes>

parameters.name: min_matches
parameters.description: The minimum number of matches played for a hero combination to be included in the response.

parameters.name: max_matches
parameters.description: The maximum number of matches played for a hero combination to be included in the response.

parameters.name: comb_size
parameters.description: The combination size to return.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Filter for matches with a specific player account ID.

parameters.name: account_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of account ids to include

500.description: Failed to fetch hero comb stats

get.description:
Retrieves hero-versus-hero matchup statistics based on historical match data.

This endpoint analyzes completed matches to calculate how often a specific hero (`hero_id`) wins against an enemy hero (`enemy_hero_id`) and the total number of times they have faced each other under the specified filter conditions.

Results are cached for **1 hour** based on the combination of query parameters provided. Subsequent identical requests within this timeframe will receive the cached response.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: game_mode
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their game mode. Valid values: `normal`, `street_brawl`. **Default:** `normal`.

parameters.name: min_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp). **Default:** 30 days ago.

parameters.name: max_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp).

parameters.name: min_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: max_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: min_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: max_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: min_enemy_networth
parameters.description: Filter enemy players based on their net worth.

parameters.name: max_enemy_networth
parameters.description: Filter enemy players based on their net worth.

parameters.name: min_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: max_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: min_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: max_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: same_lane_filter
parameters.description: When `true`, only considers matchups where both `hero_id` and `enemy_hero_id` were assigned to the same lane (e.g., both Mid Lane). When `false`, considers all matchups regardless of assigned lane.

parameters.name: min_matches
parameters.description: The minimum number of matches played for a hero combination to be included in the response.

parameters.name: max_matches
parameters.description: The maximum number of matches played for a hero combination to be included in the response.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Filter for matches with a specific player account ID.

parameters.name: account_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of account ids to include

500.description: Failed to fetch hero counter stats

### Rate Limits:

| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: Bucket allows you to group the stats by a specific field.

parameters.name: game_mode
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their game mode. Valid values: `normal`, `street_brawl`. **Default:** `normal`.

parameters.name: min_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp). **Default:** 30 days ago.

parameters.name: max_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp).

parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: max_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: min_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: max_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: min_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: max_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: min_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: max_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: min_hero_matches
parameters.description: Filter players based on the number of matches they have played with a specific hero within the filtered time range.

parameters.name: max_hero_matches
parameters.description: Filter players based on the number of matches they have played with a specific hero within the filtered time range.

parameters.name: min_hero_matches_total
parameters.description: Filter players based on the number of matches they have played with a specific hero in their entire history.

parameters.name: max_hero_matches_total
parameters.description: Filter players based on the number of matches they have played with a specific hero in their entire history.

parameters.name: include_item_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of item ids to include (only players who have purchased these items). See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/items>

parameters.name: exclude_item_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of item ids to exclude (only players who have not purchased these items). See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/items>

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Filter for matches with a specific player account ID.

parameters.name: account_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of account ids to include

get.description:
Retrieves hero pair synergy statistics based on historical match data.

This endpoint analyzes completed matches to calculate how often a specific pair of heroes (`hero_id1` and `hero_id2`) won when playing *together on the same team*, and the total number of times they have played together under the specified filter conditions.

Results are cached for **1 hour** based on the combination of query parameters provided. Subsequent identical requests within this timeframe will receive the cached response.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: game_mode
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their game mode. Valid values: `normal`, `street_brawl`. **Default:** `normal`.

parameters.name: min_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp). **Default:** 30 days ago.

parameters.name: max_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp).

parameters.name: min_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: max_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: min_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: max_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: min_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: max_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: min_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: max_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: same_lane_filter
parameters.description: When `true`, only considers matchups where both `hero_id1` and `hero_id2` were assigned to the same lane (e.g., both Mid Lane). When `false`, considers all matchups regardless of assigned lane.

parameters.name: same_party_filter
parameters.description: When `true`, only considers matchups where both `hero_id` and `hero_id2` were on the same party. When `false`, considers all matchups regardless of party affiliation.

parameters.name: min_matches
parameters.description: The minimum number of matches played for a hero combination to be included in the response.

parameters.name: max_matches
parameters.description: The maximum number of matches played for a hero combination to be included in the response.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Filter for matches with a specific player account ID.

parameters.name: account_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of account ids to include

500.description: Failed to fetch hero synergy stats

get.description:
This endpoint returns the kill-death statistics across a 100x100 pixel raster.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Filter by team number.

parameters.name: game_mode
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their game mode. Valid values: `normal`, `street_brawl`. **Default:** `normal`.

parameters.name: min_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp). **Default:** 30 days ago.

parameters.name: max_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp).

parameters.name: min_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: max_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: account_ids
parameters.description: Filter matches by account IDs of players that participated in the match.

parameters.name: hero_ids
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the hero IDs. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/heroes>

parameters.name: min_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: max_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: is_high_skill_range_parties
parameters.description: Filter matches based on whether they are in the high skill range.

parameters.name: is_low_pri_pool
parameters.description: Filter matches based on whether they are in the low priority pool.

parameters.name: is_new_player_pool

parameters.name: min_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: max_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: min_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: max_average_badge

get.description:
Retrieves player performance statistics (net worth, kills, deaths, assists) over time throughout matches.

Results are cached for **1 hour** based on the unique combination of query parameters provided.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description:
Resolution for relative game times in percent (0-100).
**Default:** 10 (buckets of 10%).
Set to **0** to use absolute game time (seconds).

parameters.name: game_mode
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their game mode. Valid values: `normal`, `street_brawl`. **Default:** `normal`.

parameters.name: min_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp). **Default:** 30 days ago.

parameters.name: max_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp).

parameters.name: min_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: max_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: min_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: max_networth
parameters.description: Filter players based on their final net worth.

parameters.name: min_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: max_average_badge
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the average badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit) of *both* teams involved. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

parameters.name: min_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: max_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: hero_ids
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the hero IDs. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/heroes>

parameters.name: include_item_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of item ids to include (only players who have purchased these items). See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/items>

parameters.name: exclude_item_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of item ids to exclude (only players who have not purchased these items). See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/items>

parameters.name: account_ids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of account ids to include

500.description: Failed to fetch player performance curve

get.description:
Returns comprehensive statistical analysis of player performance.

Results are cached for **1 hour** based on the unique combination of query parameters provided. Subsequent identical requests within this timeframe will receive the cached response.

> Note: Quantiles are calculated using the [DDSketch](https://www.vldb.org/pvldb/vol12/p2195-masson.pdf) algorithm, so they are not exact but have a maximum relative error of 0.01.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: hero_ids
parameters.description: Filter matches based on the hero IDs. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/heroes>

parameters.name: game_mode
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their game mode. Valid values: `normal`, `street_brawl`. **Default:** `normal`.

parameters.name: min_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp). **Default:** 30 days ago.

post.description:
This endpoint creates a custom match using a bot account.

**Process:**
1. A party is created with your provided settings.
2. The system waits for the party code to be generated.
3. The party code is returned in the response.
4. The bot switches to spectator mode.
5. The bot marks itself as ready.
6. You and other players join, ready up, and start the match.

**Callbacks:**
If a callback URL is provided, POST requests will be sent to it:
- **settings:** When lobby settings change, a POST is sent to `{callback_url}/settings` with the `CsoCitadelParty` protobuf message as JSON.
- **match start:** When the match starts, a POST is sent to `{callback_url}` with the match ID.

_Protobuf definitions: [https://github.com/SteamDatabase/Protobufs](https://github.com/SteamDatabase/Protobufs)_

**Note:**
The bot will leave the match 15 minutes after creation, regardless of match state.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | API-Key ONLY |
| Key | 100req/30min |
| Global | 1000req/h |

This endpoint makes the bot leave the custom match lobby early.
By default the bot leaves automatically after 15 minutes, but this endpoint allows you to trigger it sooner.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | API-Key ONLY |
| Key | 100req/30min |
| Global | 1000req/h |

post.description:
You can use this endpoint to help us collecting data.

The endpoint accepts a list of MatchSalts objects, which contain the following fields:

- `match_id`: The match ID
- `cluster_id`: The cluster ID
- `metadata_salt`: The metadata salt
- `replay_salt`: The replay salt
- `username`: The username of the person who submitted the match

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

400.description: Provided parameters are invalid or the salt check failed.

See: https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Steam_Web_API#GetPlayerSummaries_(v0002)

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: Search query for Steam profiles.

get.description:
This endpoint returns the enemy stats.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The players `SteamID3`

parameters.name: game_mode
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their game mode. Valid values: `normal`, `street_brawl`. **Default:** `normal`.

parameters.name: min_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp).

parameters.name: max_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp).

parameters.name: min_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: max_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: min_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: max_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: min_matches_played
parameters.description: Filter based on the number of matches played.

parameters.name: max_matches_played
parameters.description: Filter based on the number of matches played.

get.description:
This endpoint returns the player match history for the given `account_id`. The player match history is a combination of the data from **Steam** and **ClickHouse**, so you always get the most up-to-date data and full history. Protobuf definitions can be found here: [https://github.com/SteamDatabase/Protobufs](https://github.com/SteamDatabase/Protobufs) Relevant Protobuf Messages: - CMsgClientToGcGetMatchHistory - CMsgClientToGcGetMatchHistoryResponse ### Rate Limits: | Type | Limit | | ---- | ----- | | IP | 5req/h
With `only_stored_history=true`: 100req/s
With `force_refetch=true`: 5req/h | | Key | 400req/h
With `only_stored_history=true`: -
With `force_refetch=true`: 5req/h | | Global | 2000req/h
With `only_stored_history=true`: -
With `force_refetch=true`: 10req/h |

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The players `SteamID3`

parameters.name: force_refetch
parameters.description:
Refetch the match history from Steam, even if it is already cached in `ClickHouse`.
Only use this if you are sure that the data in `ClickHouse` is outdated.
Enabling this flag results in a strict rate limit.

parameters.name: only_stored_history
parameters.description:
Return only the already stored match history from `ClickHouse`.
There is no rate limit for this option, so if you need a lot of data, you can use this option.
This option is not compatible with `force_refetch`.

| IP | 100req/s |

| Global | - |

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: The players `SteamID3`

parameters.name: game_mode
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their game mode. Valid values: `normal`, `street_brawl`. **Default:** `normal`.

parameters.name: min_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp).

parameters.name: max_unix_timestamp
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their start time (Unix timestamp).

parameters.name: min_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: max_duration_s
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their duration in seconds (up to 7000s).

parameters.name: min_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: max_match_id
parameters.description: Filter matches based on their ID.

parameters.name: min_matches_played
parameters.description: Filter based on the number of matches played.

parameters.name: max_matches_played
parameters.description: Filter based on the number of matches played.

parameters.name: same_party
parameters.description:
Filter based on whether the mates were on the same party.
**Careful:** this will require us to use the match metadata, which can have missing matches.

get.description:
Executes a SQL query on the database.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 300req/5min |
| Key | 300req/5min |
| Global | 600req/60s |

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The SQL query to execute. It must follow the Clickhouse SQL syntax.

get.description:
Lists all tables in the database.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

Returns the schema of a table.

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: The name of the table to fetch the schema for.

fetched_matches_per_day.description: The number of matches fetched in the last 24 hours.

table_sizes.description: The sizes of all tables in the database.

user_ingested_matches_last24h.description: The number of matches ingested in the last 24 hours.

badge_level.description: The badge level (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit). See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

callback_url.description: If a callback url is provided, we will send a POST request to this url when the match starts.

disable_auto_ready.description:
If auto-ready is disabled, the bot will not automatically ready up.
You need to call the `ready` endpoint to ready up.

callback_secret.description:
If a callback url is provided, this is the secret that should be used to verify the callback.
The secret is a base64 encoded random string. To verify it you should compare it with the X-Callback-Secret header.
If no callback url is provided, this will be None.

match_id.description: Valve's match id of the match.

provider.description: The provider of the match data. Some string that identifies the source of the data.

scheduled_date.description: The scheduled date of the match.

oneOf.description: The status of the match, e.g. live, completed, scheduled, cancelled.

team0_name.description: The name of the first team.

team1_name.description: The name of the second team.

update_id.description: If you want to update an existing match, you can provide an update id.

wins.description: The amount of matches won against the enemy.

rank.description: tier = first digits, subtier = last digit, see more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

assists.description: The number of assists by `hero_id` when facing `enemy_hero_id`.

creeps.description: The number of creeps killed by `hero_id` when facing `enemy_hero_id`.

deaths.description: The number of deaths by `hero_id` when facing `enemy_hero_id`.

denies.description: The number of denies by `hero_id` when facing `enemy_hero_id`.

enemy_assists.description: The number of assists by `enemy_hero_id` when facing `hero_id`.

enemy_creeps.description: The number of creeps killed by `enemy_hero_id` when facing `hero_id`.

enemy_deaths.description: The number of deaths by `enemy_hero_id` when facing `hero_id`.

enemy_denies.description: The number of denies by `enemy_hero_id` when facing `hero_id`.

enemy_hero_id.description: The ID of the opposing hero. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/heroes>

enemy_kills.description: The number of kills by `enemy_hero_id` when facing `hero_id`.

enemy_last_hits.description: The number of last hits by `enemy_hero_id` when facing `hero_id`.

enemy_networth.description: The net worth of `enemy_hero_id` when facing `hero_id`.

enemy_obj_damage.description: The amount of objective damage dealt by `enemy_hero_id` when facing `hero_id`.

hero_id.description: The ID of the hero. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/heroes>

kills.description: The number of kills by `hero_id` when facing `enemy_hero_id`.

last_hits.description: The number of last hits by `hero_id` when facing `enemy_hero_id`.

matches_played.description: The total number of matches played between `hero_id` and `enemy_hero_id` that meet the filter criteria.

networth.description: The net worth of `hero_id` when facing `enemy_hero_id`.

obj_damage.description: The amount of objective damage dealt by `hero_id` when facing `enemy_hero_id`.

wins.description: The number of times `hero_id` won the match when facing `enemy_hero_id`.

assists1.description: The number of assists by `hero_id1` when playing with `hero_id2`.

assists2.description: The number of assists by `hero_id2` when playing with `hero_id1`.

creeps1.description: The number of creeps killed by `hero_id1` when playing with `hero_id2`.

creeps2.description: The number of creeps killed by `hero_id2` when playing with `hero_id1`.

deaths1.description: The number of deaths by `hero_id1` when playing with `hero_id2`.

deaths2.description: The number of deaths by `hero_id2` when playing with `hero_id1`.

denies1.description: The number of denies by `hero_id1` when playing with `hero_id2`.

denies2.description: The number of denies by `hero_id2` when playing with `hero_id1`.

hero_id1.description: The ID of the first hero in the pair.

hero_id2.description: The ID of the second hero in the pair.

kills1.description: The number of kills by `hero_id1` when playing with `hero_id2`.

kills2.description: The number of kills by `hero_id2` when playing with `hero_id1`.

last_hits1.description: The number of last hits by `hero_id1` when playing with `hero_id2`.

last_hits2.description: The number of last hits by `hero_id2` when playing with `hero_id1`.

matches_played.description: The total number of matches played where `hero_id1` and `hero_id2` were on the same team, meeting the filter criteria.

networth1.description: The net worth of `hero_id1` when playing with `hero_id2`.

networth2.description: The net worth of `hero_id2` when playing with `hero_id1`.

obj_damage1.description: The amount of objective damage dealt by `hero_id1` when playing with `hero_id2`.

obj_damage2.description: The amount of objective damage dealt by `hero_id2` when playing with `hero_id1`.

wins.description: The number of times the team won when both `hero_id1` and `hero_id2` were on the same team.

avg_buy_time_relative.description: Average buy time as percentage of match duration

avg_sell_time_relative.description: Average sell time as percentage of match duration (for items that were sold)

avg_sell_time_s.description: Average sell time in seconds (absolute, for items that were sold)

account_name.description: The account name of the player.

badge_level.description: The badge level of the player (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit). See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

possible_account_ids.description: The possible account IDs of the player. **CAVEAT: This is not always correct, as Steam account names are not unique.**

rank.description: The rank of the player (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit). See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

ranked_rank.description: The ranked rank of the player. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

ranked_subrank.description: The ranked subrank of the player. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

top_hero_ids.description: The top hero IDs of the player. See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/heroes>

division.description: Extracted from the rank the division (rank // 10)

division_tier.description: Extracted from the rank the division tier (rank % 10)

player_score.description: Player Score is the index for the rank array (internally used for the rank regression)

rank.description: The Player Rank (tier = first digits, subtier = last digit). See more: <https://assets.deadlock-api.com/v2/ranks>

assists_avg.description: Average assists at this time point

assists_std.description: Standard deviation of assists at this time point

deaths_avg.description: Average deaths at this time point

deaths_std.description: Standard deviation of deaths at this time point

game_time.description:
The time point of the data.
If `resolution` (default 10) is > 0, this is a percentage (0, 10, ..., 100).
If `resolution` is 0, this is the match time in seconds.

kills_avg.description: Average kills at this time point

kills_std.description: Standard deviation of kills at this time point

net_worth_avg.description: Average net worth at this time point

net_worth_std.description: Standard deviation of net worth at this time point

data_compressed_bytes.description: Compressed size of the table in bytes.

data_uncompressed_bytes.description: Uncompressed size of the table in bytes.

is_view.description: Whether the table is a view.

rows.description: Number of rows in the table.

default_label.description: The default label for the variable.

extra_args.description: Extra arguments that can be passed to the variable.

tags.name: Matches
tags.description:
Comprehensive match data endpoints for retrieving detailed information about games.
Provides access to active matches, match metadata, replay salts, and more.

tags.name: MMR
tags.description:
# STOP! READ THIS FIRST!

Please be very careful when using this endpoint and make yourself familiar with the way we calculate the MMR.

This is how we calculate a player MMR.

1. We take the average badge of the team the player was on in a match.
2. We convert the badge to a MMR score using the formula: `(intDiv(badge, 10) - 1) * 6 + (badge % 10)`
3. We do a exponential moving average (EMA) of the last 50 matches to get the player's MMR score.
4. We convert the MMR score back to a badge using the formula: `10 * intDiv(mmr_score, 6) + 1 + mmr_score % 6`

### Rate Limits:
| Type | Limit |
| ---- | ----- |
| IP | 100req/s |
| Key | - |
| Global | - |

tags.name: Leaderboard
tags.description:
Endpoints for retrieving global and hero-specific leaderboards.
Supports filtering by region and provides data in both JSON and protobuf formats.

tags.name: Analytics
tags.description:
Comprehensive game statistics and analysis endpoints.
Provides detailed performance metrics for heroes, items, and players, including hero synergies, counters, and combinations.
Features scoreboards for both heroes and players.

tags.name: Builds
tags.description: Search and retrieve hero builds with comprehensive filtering options.

tags.name: Patches
tags.description: Endpoints that return data about game patches.

tags.name: Commands
tags.description:
Integration endpoints for the [Deadlock Streamkit](https://streamkit.deadlock-api.com/).
Provides functionality to resolve dynamic command templates and variables for streaming overlays and chat commands.
Includes endpoints to retrieve available variables, resolve specific variables or command templates, and get widget version information.

tags.name: Info
tags.description:
System status and info endpoints.
Provides health checks for monitoring service availability (Clickhouse, Postgres, Redis) and API statistics including database table sizes, match fetching rates, and missed matches.

tags.name: SQL
tags.description:
Database exploration endpoints for direct SQL access.
Provides functionality to execute custom SQL queries with rate limiting protection, list available tables, and inspect table schemas.
